qas.question: What ancient group used bitumen extraction?
When were the first published reports of bitumen extraction in Albania?
What government had exploitation rights for bitumen extraction?
When were the Ottoman rights given to the Simsa company?
When was management of Albanian bitumen acquired by the French?
The last known mentions of Albanian bitumen appeared in what year?
The Albanian Coquand published the first description of what?
When were the exploitation rights given to the Roman Empire?
When did Simsa receive the industrial scale?
What was transferred to Simsa in 1917?

context: The Albanian bitumen extraction has a long history and was practiced in an organized way by the <a0_0>Romans<a0_0/>. After centuries of silence, the first mentions of Albanian bitumen appeared only in <a1_0><b5_0>1868<b5_0/><a1_0/>, when the Frenchman Coquand published the first geological description of the <b6_0>deposits of Albanian bitumen<b6_0/>. In <b7_0>1875<b7_0/>, the <b9_0>exploitation rights<b9_0/> were granted to the <a2_0>Ottoman<a2_0/> government and in <a3_0><b8_0>1912<b8_0/><a3_0/>, they were transferred to the Italian company Simsa. Since 1945, the mine was exploited by the Albanian government and from <a4_0>2001<a4_0/> to date, the management passed to a French company, which organized the mining process for the manufacture of the natural bitumen on an industrial scale.
